geometry

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.Line

  • public class Line
extends Object
    Represents a line in 2D plane. Line can be used by given start and end point or for line can be given equation parameters in form of ax + bx = c. If there is no start and end point defined, some features are unavailable.
    Author:
    lroni
    See Also:
    Point

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(double[] parameters)
      Creates a line with given parameters.
      Line(Point start, Point end)
      Creates a line with given start and end Point and calculates line's distance

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point findIntersect(Line line)
      Returns point where this line and the given line intersects.
      double[] findPerpendicularLine()
      Returns line in perpendicular, that is -bx + ay = c
      double[] findPerpendicularLineByPoint(Point p)
      Returns line in perpendicular to this line so it goes through given point

      Returns end point
      double getLength()
      Returns length of line

      Returns the midpoint of this line, that is average of the start and end points

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line(Point start,
            Point end)
        Creates a line with given start and end Point and calculates line's distance
        Parameters:
        start - Start point
        end - End point

      • Line

        public Line(double[] parameters)
        Creates a line with given parameters. Notice that without start and end point some feature are unavailable.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Line's equation in form ax + bx = c, where a is the first element in array, b is the second element and c is the third element

    • Method Detail

      • getStart

        public Point getStart()
        Returns start point
        Returns:
        Start point

      • getEnd

        public Point getEnd()
        Returns end point
        Returns:
        End point

      • getLength

        public double getLength()
        Returns length of line
        Returns:
        length

      • getParameters

        public double[] getParameters()

      • getMidPoint

        public Point getMidPoint()
        Returns the midpoint of this line, that is average of the start and end points
        Returns:
        Point representing midpoint of this line or null if start and end is not defined.

      • solveLine

        public double[] solveLine()
        Returns parameters for line which passes trough start and end point in this object
        Returns:
        line in format ax + by = c, where a is the first element in output array, b is the second element and c is the third element

      • findPerpendicularLine

        public double[] findPerpendicularLine()
        Returns line in perpendicular, that is -bx + ay = c
        Returns:
        line in format ax + by = c, where a is the first element in output array, b is the second element and c is the third element

      • findPerpendicularLineByPoint

        public double[] findPerpendicularLineByPoint(Point p)
        Returns line in perpendicular to this line so it goes through given point
        Parameters:
        p - Point by the perpendicular line should go
        Returns:
        parameters for line in format ax + by = c, where a is the first element in output array, b is the second element and c is the third element

      • findIntersect

        public Point findIntersect(Line line)
        Returns point where this line and the given line intersects.
        Parameters:
        line - Line to intersect
        Returns:
        the intersect point or null if lines are parallel

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
